column4: does anyone here use Avast? after updating, mine doesn't run... can anyone help? :p
why do you need avast ???
I thought it'd be good to have? I don't know jack about Linux, so I figured there could be viruses from the internet...?
there are no viruses spreading in the wild, currently.
oh, hmkay, so should I uninstall it? :p
and there was only one REAL virus for linux, and it failed to start because of a kernel bug.
rofl... hmkay. What about firewalls, do I need those?
firewall is already installed, and should protect your computer even with default config
oh I see. Thank you very much
you dont have to configure your firewall. it's already configured to shield you. if you dont believe me, test it with ShieldsUP
no, I trust you. ^
one final question, is there a list of *online* games for Linux/Ubuntu anywhere? Every site I find lists only a few...
do you mean games you play with your browser ?
or the games you install on a PC ?
installation ones
http://gaming.gwos.org/         this site seems to be down currently
but i can tell you a few games, if you want
oh, I'd love that.

Tremulous, located in Ubuntu's repos, you can install it using the Add/Remove program, theres Wolfenstein Enemy Territory, and True Combat : Elite, ET's mod. Then there's Enemy Territory Quake Wars, a quite new game with a native linux client. And there is Urban Terror. Those are the games I play, but there are others. I can tell you more, if you want
those will get me started, thank you
I can give you websites for those games, if you want
but there arent many linux games, so dont expect gaming to be as good as in windows
IMO, lack of games is only thing that keeps Linux non-widely used. But as linux gains more community, game makers will start producing games for it
I can't seem to find tremulous on Add/Remove
I wrote down what you said for reference. Could you give me the website for Enemy Territory?
open System>Administration>Software sources and make sure that Universe is enabled
Quake Wars or Wolfenstein ?
uuuhhh.... like, what's the difference?
well, Quake Wars isn't free and is newer
hm, Wolfenstein, then
i dont think that Wolfenstein ET has website. but download link : http://games.softpedia.com/get/Freeware-Games/Return-To-Castle-Wolfenstein-Enemy-Territory-FREE-FULL-GAME.shtml
oh, wait a little
i gave you windows link
what is the Universe thing? Main server? It says "download from" and it gives me the option of our Brazillian server and main server... do you mean I should change to main?
no
http://www.fileshack.com/file.x?fid=2743    wolfenstein ET
once it's downloaded, open up terminal and type "./et-linux-2.60.x86.run"
and before that "chmod +x et-linux-2.60.x86.run"
BEFORE
hmkay, I wrote that down. Should I get packages from my brazilian server or main server?
brazilian server
dont worry about the terminal work. in the end, you'll see its quite simple
i can tell you a few terminal commands you'll probably need to know, if you want
yesh, I'd like that. I only know of dpkg -i packagename
join #ubuntu1 channel
I'm downloading Tremulous now... one hour to go. Thank you. Does it take over 64mb of video memory?
well, im not sure, but tremulous doesnt generally require a good computer
you only got 64 MB of video memory ?
yeah... it's an over 5 years old computer.
i guess no fancy effects for you
I've only come across one game that doesn't run on it, though
what game ? oh, and btw - ET quake wars wont run on it
hmkay, I'm not paying for anything anyway... :p~ The game is Archlord. It needs at least 128 video memory
well, what flavour of ubuntu you got ?
what do you mean? Version? If so, it's 7.10
do you have Ubuntu, Xubuntu or Kubuntu ?
Ubuntu
then i guess it runs quite slowly ?
nope
how much RAM u got ?
I have 768mb ram memory
k
what ?
Tremulous' download :(
ok
btw, did you install your graphics' card driver ?
I don't know, not manually, but Linux did detect the card driver...
the card, I mean. the driver, I dunno
but I played tuxcart on full speed, so I guess that means it's okay?
yes, probably
just to make sure : open System>Administration>Restricted driver manager
ya, okay, my NVIDIA acceleration driver is checked
I had to authorize that on install... so that's why I fugired it'd be fine
well, right after installation.
do you know how to use self complete function ?
I don't know what's that, so, no.
you can just type a part of my name, or filename, or whatever, and press TAB so it will autocomplete itself. type "bor" and press TAB
oooh, that I knew, cuz I have used mirc scripts before, ^^.
I thought you were talking about something in Ubuntu.
well, you can use same feature in gnome terminal, because you have to include special slashes when typing some filenames
my keyboard has those slashes. do you mean \ and /?
yes, but , for example, directory called 'Program Files'  will have to be typed 'Program\ Files/' in terminal, else it wont work
oh, I see.
this is most notable when using compatibility layers like WINE
oh, but I have windows on this computer as well, so I don't intend to use WINE so soon...
since it uses Windows' directory tree, which linux terminal doesnt support
since I like to play Gunz: the Duel and some other games.
and it's probably hard to configurate WINE for me.
im gonna play tremulous, bye
bai bai!
